sen.j: 長白羽神（ながしらはのかみ）は古語拾遺の岩戸隠れに登場する神。
sen.e: Nagashiraha no kami was the god appeared in Iwato-gakure (the hiding of Amaterasu Omikami, the sun goddess, in the heavenly rock cave) of Kogo-shui (History of the Inbe clan).
Nagashiraha no kami was a god appearing in Iwato-gakure (the hiding of Amaterasu Omikami, the sun goddess, in the heavenly rock cave) of Kogo-shui (History of the Inbe clan).
Nagashiraha no kami was a god appearing in Iwato-gakure (the hiding of Amaterasu Omikami, the sun goddess, in the heavenly rock cave) of Kogo-shui (History of the Inbe clan).

sen.j: オモイカネに命じられ、麻を育て青和幣（あおにぎて）を織ったという。
sen.e: By Omoikane (the god of wisdom and talent)'s order, he raised hemp and weaved Aonigite (blue fabric to hang on a branch of sakaki to put it on the altar).
By Omoikane (the god of wisdom and talent)'s order, he raised hemp and weaved Aonigite (blue fabric to hang on a branch of sakaki to put it on the altar).
By Omoikane (the god of wisdom and talent)'s order, he raised hemp and weaved Aonigite (blue fabric to hang on a branch of sakaki to put it on the altar).

sen.j: 神麻続機殿神社で伊勢神宮に奉納する荒妙（あらたえ）を織った神麻続部（かんおみべ、神麻績部とも）の祖神とされ、白い衣類を白羽と呼んだのは長白羽神に由来するとされる。
sen.e: He was considered as soshin (ancestor honored as god) of Kanomibe who weaved aratae (hemp fabric) to dedicate to Ise-jingu Shrine at Hatadono-jinja Shrine, Kanomi Hatadono-jinja Shrine, and it derived from Nagashiraha no kami to call white clothes shiraha.

He was considered to be a soshin (ancestor honored as god) of Kanomibe who weaved aratae (hemp fabric) to dedicate to Ise-jingu Shrine at Hatadono-jinja Shrine, Kanomi Hatadono-jinja Shrine, and it derived from Nagashiraha no kami to call white clothes shiraha.

He was considered to be a soshin (ancestor honored as god) of Kanomibe who weaved aratae (hemp fabric) to dedicate to Ise-jingu Shrine at Kanomi Hatadono-jinja Shrine, and it derived from Nagashiraha no kami to call white clothes shiraha.
sen.cmt: 機殿神社原文から削除Hatadono-jinja Shrine,削除

sen.j: フトダマの同族神であるという。
sen.e: He was Dozokushin (god of the same family) of Futodama.
He was Dozokushin (god of the same family) of Futodama.
He was Dozokushin (god of the same family) of Futodama.

sen.j: 別名を天白羽神（あめのしらはのかみ）といい、天白信仰を長白羽神由来とする説がある。
sen.e: Another name was Amenoshiraha no kami, and one theory said Nagashiraha no kami derived from Tenpaku Shinko (folk religion in the east half of Japan).
Another name was Amenoshiraha no kami, and one theory said Nagashiraha no kami derived from Tenpaku Shinko (folk religion in the east half of Japan).
Another name was Amenoshiraha no kami, and one theory said Nagashiraha no kami derived from Tenpaku Shinko (folk religion in the east half of Japan).

sen.j: 常陸国久慈郡（現茨城県常陸太田市）の延喜式神名帳・天之志良波神社の祭神として祀られている。
sen.e: He was enshrined as the enshrined deity of Amenoshiraha-jinja Shrine stated in Engishiki jinmyocho (a register of shrines in Japan) of Kuji County, Hitachi Province (present Hitachi-ota City, Ibaraki Prefecture).

He was enshrined as the enshrined deity of Amenoshiraha-jinja Shrine stated in Engishiki jinmyocho (a register of shrines in Japan) of Kuji County, Hitachi Province (present Hitachi-ota City, Ibaraki Prefecture).
